meanings.definition: The act of making amends or compensating for a wrong or injury.
meanings.sent1: She offered a heartfelt reparation for her mistake.
meanings.sent2: The court ordered him to pay reparation to the victim's family.
meanings.sent3: He tried to make reparation by baking cookies for his neighbor.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a reparation for the hurtful words she had said.
meanings.sent5: The reparation he made by fixing the broken vase was appreciated.

meanings.definition: The payment of money or other forms of compensation for damages.
meanings.sent1: The insurance company provided reparation for the car accident.
meanings.sent2: He received reparation for the property damage caused by the storm.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bonus was a welcome reparation for his hard work.
meanings.sent4: The refund served as reparation for the faulty product.
meanings.sent5: She demanded reparation for the late delivery of the package.

meanings.definition: The process of repairing or restoring something to its original condition.
meanings.sent1: The reparation of the old house took months to complete.
meanings.sent2: He specialized in the reparation of antique furniture.
meanings.sent3: The reparation of the broken toy turned into a fun family project.
meanings.sent4: The reparation of the relationship required time and effort.
meanings.sent5: The reparation of the torn painting was a delicate task.
